channel.title: Bloomberg Markets

item.title: Sony Sees $700 Million Tariff Hit on Underwhelming Outlook
item.description: Sony Group Corp. offered an underwhelming forecast for the year ahead, with the burden of US tariffs wiping out expectations for an increase in operating profit.
item.dc:creator: Yuki Furukawa, Takashi Mochizuki

media:content.media:description: The Sony PlayStation 5 Pro controller. Photographer: Kiyoshi Ota/Bloomberg

item.title: India’s RBI Reviews Some E-Wallets After Taxi App Goes Bust
item.description: India’s central bank is scrutinizing some digital wallets associated with electric-vehicle players after the sudden collapse of the country’s largest all-EV taxi service left users unable to access money tied to their accounts, people familiar with the matter said.
item.dc:creator: Alisha Sachdev

media:content.media:description: A BluSmart cab drive past on a road in New Delhi on April 17, 2025. India's all-electric ride-hailing start-up BluSmart suddenly halted new bookings on April 17 after the market regulator found an affiliate company misused funds meant for purchasing green vehicles. (Photo by Money SHARMA / AFP) (Photo by MONEY SHARMA/AFP via Getty Images) Photographer: MONEY SHARMA/AFP

item.title: Bloomberg: The Asia Trade 05/14/2025
item.description: "Bloomberg: The Asia Trade" brings you everything you need to know to get ahead as the trading day begins in Asia. Bloomberg TV is live from Tokyo and Sydney with Shery Ahn and Haidi Stroud-Watts, getting insight and analysis from newsmakers and industry leaders on the biggest stories shaping global markets. (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Nissan Shares Fall on Annual Loss, Withheld Profit Outlook
item.description: Nissan Motor Co. shares fell after the Japanese automaker posted an annual net loss of ¥670.9 billion ($4.5 billion) and decided against issuing an operating profit forecast for the current fiscal year.
item.dc:creator: Alice French

media:content.media:description: Signage atop the Nissan Motor Co. global headquarters in Yokohama, Japan, on Tuesday, March 11, 2025. Nissan named company insider Ivan Espinosa to replace Chief Executive Officer Makoto Uchida and helm the battered Japanese carmaker as it looks to secure a financial backer and stabilize its foundering business.

item.title: Australia’s Queensland to Issue More Euro Debt After Strong Sale
item.description: Australia’s Queensland state intends to issue more euro-denominated debt after it garnered strong demand for its first-ever benchmark issuance in the currency as it taps offshore markets to broaden the investor base.
item.dc:creator: Matthew Burgess, Masaki Kondo

item.title: Asian Stocks Gain Ahead of Chinese Tech Earnings: Markets Wrap
item.description: Asia’s benchmark stock index rose, led by the tech sector, as investors awaited earnings from some of the largest Chinese technology firms this week.
item.dc:creator: Aya Wagatsuma

item.title: Tencent, Alibaba Results Key to Cementing China Tech Stock Rally
item.description: Earnings from the two biggest names in China tech are the next big watchpoint for clues on whether one of 2025’s hottest stock rallies is back on track.
item.dc:creator: Charlotte Yang, Bailey Lipschultz

media:content.media:description: The logo for Alibaba Group Holding Ltd.'s cloud unit displayed during the Alibaba Cloud AI Tech Day event in Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia, on Thursday, Feb. 27, 2025. Alibaba pledged to invest more than 380 billion yuan ($53 billion) on AI infrastructure such as data centers over the next three years, a major commitment that underscores the e-commerce pioneer’s ambitions of becoming a leader in artificial intelligence.

item.title: China Tech Now 'Attractive': UBS' Yifan Hu
item.description: UBS Global Wealth Management CIO Yifan Hu says China's tech sector is now considered "attractive" at a time when more clients are interested in diversifying away from dollar assets. Hu speaks on Bloomberg's The China Show. (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Iron Ore Bounces Back to Six-Week High on Trade-War Truce Hopes
item.description: Iron ore rose as trade tensions eased, spurring optimism across a metals market that has been hit especially hard by global growth worries.
item.dc:creator: Katharine Gemmell

item.title: Carlyle Seeks $1.2 Billion Loan for India Hexaware M&A Refinance
item.description: Carlyle Group Inc is seeking about $1.2 billion in a syndicated loan to refinance debt used to acquire Mumbai-based software firm Hexaware Technologies Ltd., according to people familiar with the matter.
item.dc:creator: Chien Mi Wong, Kari Soo Lindberg

media:content.media:description: Hexaware’s CEO, Srikrishna Ramakarthikeyan, second from left, and other executives attend the company’s listing ceremony at the National Stock Exchange in Mumbai in February.

item.title: Millennium Hires Ex-UBS Asia-Pacific Equity Derivatives Head
item.description: Millennium Management hired UBS Group AG’s former equity derivatives head for Asia-Pacific, the latest move by the $73 billion investment giant to tap investment bank executives for expansion.
item.dc:creator: Bei Hu

media:content.media:description: Buildings in Hong Kong, China, on Tuesday, Jan. 9, 2024. The chill in Hong Kong's housing market is prompting owners of luxury homes to rent out their properties instead of selling. Photographer: Paul Yeung/Bloomberg

item.title: PBOC Daily Yuan Support Below Estimates for First Time This Year
item.description: China scaled back its efforts to buoy the yuan, with one degree of daily support missing analyst estimates for the first time this year, amid a rebound on signs of easing trade tensions.
item.dc:creator: Tian Chen, Ran Li

media:content.media:description: The People's Bank of China (PBOC) building in Beijing, China, on Friday, Nov. 8, 2024. China's bond traders are watching a key legislative meeting this week where lawmakers are expected to approve a fiscal package worth trillions of yuan.

item.title: India’s 10 Richest Add Over $16 Billion After Biggest Stock Rally in Four Years
item.description: Before the trading day starts we bring you a digest of the key news and events that are likely to move markets. Today we look at:
item.dc:creator: Chiranjivi Chakraborty

item.title: Taiwan Regulator Probes Firms for Pressuring Staff to Sell ETFs
item.description: Taiwan’s financial regulator is probing 20 financial institutions over how they pushed staff to sell exchange-traded fund products, the latest sign of excessive competition in one of Asia’s biggest ETF markets.
item.dc:creator: Cindy Wang, Chien-Hua Wan

item.title: Trump Favors $40-$50 Oil, Goldman Says After Scrutinizing Posts
item.description: US President Donald Trump appears to prefer oil prices between $40 and $50 a barrel, according to Goldman Sachs Group Inc., citing an in-house analysis of his social-media posts on the topic.
item.dc:creator: Jake Lloyd-Smith

item.title: Reweighting Further Outside the US, AIA Group CIO Says
item.description: AIA Group CIO Mark Konyn says the "overall view is the US economy will slow this year." His firm is reweighting "further outside the US, taking opportunities in other markets," but also generally slightly underweight equities. Konyn speaks on Bloomberg Television. (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Cobalt Market Awaits Congo Plan That May Roil Battery Industry
item.description: A forthcoming decision by the Democratic Republic of Congo on cobalt exports could potentially send prices for the metal soaring and lead battery makers to seek alternatives, an industry group said.
item.dc:creator: Michael J Kavanagh

media:content.media:description: TOPSHOT - Congolese workers stand beside bags of a mixture of cobalt and copper at the STL (Société pour le traitement du terril de Lubumbashi) processing plant during a maintenance day on December 1, 2011. The plant extracts copper, cobalt and iron from the towering "mountain" of slag that has come to symbolise the Democratic Republic of Congo's second city, and capital of the mining province of Katanga, Lubumbashi. The plant employs 388 Congolese workers, out of a total of 397 employees. AFP PHOTO / PHIL MOORE (Photo by PHIL MOORE / AFP) (Photo by PHIL MOORE/AFP via Getty Images)

item.title: Oil Holds Four-Day Gain Spurred by Trade Optimism, Iran Remarks
item.description: Oil held the bulk of its biggest four-day rally since October, spurred by US-China trade detente and President Donald Trump’s increasingly hostile rhetoric on Iranian supply,
item.dc:creator: Sarah Chen

media:content.media:description: A gas flare burns from a pipe aboard an offshore oil platform in the Persian Gulf's Salman Oil Field, operated by the National Iranian Offshore Oil Co., near Lavan island, Iran, on Thursday, Jan. 5. 2017. Nov. 5 is the day when sweeping U.S. sanctions on Iran’s energy and banking sectors go back into effect after Trump’s decision in May to walk away from the six-nation deal with Iran that suspended them. Photographer: Ali Mohammadi/Bloomberg

item.title: Bullish Calls on Top Indian Aerospace Firm at Two-Year High
item.description: Bullish calls on India’s Hindustan Aeronautics Ltd. are at the highest in more than two years ahead of the state-owned company’s fourth-quarter earnings on Wednesday.
item.dc:creator: Ashutosh Joshi

item.title: Macquarie Sued by Regulator Over Misreporting of Short Sales
item.description: Australia’s markets regulator is suing Macquarie Group Ltd.’s local securities business, alleging that the firm misreported millions of short sales for more than 14 years.
item.dc:creator: Adam Haigh

media:content.media:description:
How will Australia’s newly emboldened leader deal with a White House seeking to transform the world? Listen to this special edition of the Bloomberg Australia Podcast, taped in front of a live audience at our Sydney headquarters with a panel of Bloomberg experts.
Rebecca Jones speaks with Beijing Bureau Chief Yanping Li, Washington editor Derek Wallbank, economy reporter Swati Pandey and economist James McIntyre about Anthony Albanese’s sweeping election win, and what to expect as Australia gets caught up in US President Donald Trump’s tariff war.

item.title: Samsung to Buy FläktGroup for €1.5 Billion in Data Center Play
item.description: Samsung Electronics Co. has agreed to buy FläktGroup Holding GmbH for €1.5 billion ($1.7 billion), acquiring the European heating and cooling specialist in its biggest overseas takeover in eight years.
item.dc:creator: Yoolim Lee

media:content.media:description: In this photo taken on April 30, 2024, Samsung manufactured air-conditioning units are seen outside a building in Seoul. (Photo by ANTHONY WALLACE / AFP) (Photo by ANTHONY WALLACE/AFP via Getty Images)

item.title: Gold Holds Gain as Soft US Data Reinforces Fed Rate-Cut Bets
item.description: Gold held a small gain after US inflation data came in weaker-than-expected, spurring traders to shore up bets on interest rate cuts by the Federal Reserve.
item.dc:creator: Sybilla Gross

media:content.media:description: A one-hundred gram gold bar sits on a one kilogram gold bar at Gold Investments Ltd. bullion dealers in this arranged photograph in London, U.K., on Wednesday, July 29, 2020. Gold held its ground after a record-setting rally as investors awaited the outcome of a Federal Reserve meeting amid expectations policy makers will remain dovish, potentially spurring more gains. Photographer: Chris Ratcliffe/Bloomberg

item.title: Bain Drops Insignia Takeover Bid, CC Capital Talks Go On
item.description: Insignia Financial Ltd. said Bain Capital has dropped its takeover offer for the Australian wealth firm, but talks are continuing with the remaining bidder, CC Capital Partners.
item.dc:creator: Adam Haigh

media:content.media:description: Cranes stand in Melbourne, Australia, on Tuesday, Sept. 1, 2020. A twin-speed economy is developing in Australia and posing a challenge for the central bank, as Chinese demand for iron ore buoys the resource-rich west while eastern states struggle with Covid-19 outbreaks and border closures. Photographer: Carla Gottgens/Bloomberg

item.title: Robinhood Rival EToro, Backers Raise $620 Million in Upsized IPO
item.description: EToro Group Ltd. and some of its shareholders raised nearly $620 million in an upsized US initial public offering priced above the marketed range.
item.dc:creator: Matthew Griffin, Anthony Hughes

media:content.media:description: The EToro logo on a laptop computer arranged in Dobbs Ferry, New York, U.S., on Saturday, May 22, 2021. Elon Musk continued to toy with the price of Bitcoin Monday, taking to Twitter to indicate support for what he says is an effort by miners to make their operations greener. Photographer: Tiffany Hagler-Geard/Bloomberg

item.title: CNH CEO's Agriculture Outlook Amid Tariffs
item.description: Gerrit Marx, CNH CEO speaks with Alix Steel and Scarlet Fu about the impact of trade war on business. (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Brookfield Revives $2.4 Billion Deal for Honolulu CRE Complex
item.description: Brookfield Properties has revived a $2.4 billion debt package to refinance the Ala Moana Center, a sprawling mall and office complex in Honolulu, about a month after it halted the deal amid tariff-induced market disruption.
item.dc:creator: Scott Carpenter

media:content.media:description: The Brookfield Asset Management logo on a smartphone arranged in New York, US, on Wednesday, Nov. 8, 2023. Brookfield Asset Management raised $26 billion in the third quarter and said it's on track to bring in close to $150 billion in fresh capital this year, despite a tough fundraising environment. Photographer: Gabby Jones/Bloomberg

item.title: Transforming the Jamaica Stock Exchange
item.description: Marlene Street Forrest, Jamaica Stock Exchange, Managing Director speaks Romaine Bostick and Scarlet Fu about transforming the Jamaica Stock Market. (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Stocks Erase 2025 Drop as Nvidia Powers Tech Rally | Bloomberg: The Close 05/13/2025
item.description: Bloomberg Television brings you the latest news and analysis leading up to the final minutes and seconds before and after the closing bell on Wall Street. Today's guests are Garrett Melson, Natixis Investment, Carol Roth, Author, Sam Poser, Williams Trading, Aaron Jagdfeld, Generac, John Tozzi, Bloomberg News, Jason Pride, Glenmede, Stuart Paul, Bloomberg Economics, Arjun Murti, Veriten, Tobin Marcus, Wolfe Research, Ken Griffin, Citadel, George Hampton, Currax Pharmaceuticals. (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: CFTC Blasted in Court for ‘Bad Faith’ Misconduct in Fraud Case
item.description: A federal judge in New Jersey is weighing an unusual recommendation to sanction the US Commodity Futures Trading Commission, based on a report that the derivatives watchdog made such significant missteps in a 2023 fraud case that the agency should dismiss it and pay legal fees.
item.dc:creator: Nicola M White

media:content.media:description: The Commodity Futures Trading Commission headquarters in Washington, DC, US, on Friday, Dec. 23, 2022. The collapse of the FTX crypto exchange adds urgency to a Washington push to transform the CFTC into a top crypto watchdog, according to the head of the derivatives regulator.

item.title: No-Fee Banking Startup Chime Financial Files Publicly for IPO
item.description: Chime Financial Inc. filed publicly for an initial public offering, joining a growing number of candidates looking to go public in the brief window before the typical summer lull.
item.dc:creator: Anthony Hughes, Paige Smith, Katie Roof
